div.p: This code system https://fhir.dk.swisstph-mis.ch/matchbox/fhir/CodeSystem/emcare-custom-codes defines the following codes:

tr.td: Unique identifier provided or a universal ID, if used in the country
Child's Identity unknown/prefer to remain anonymous
The client's identity is unknown or the client's prefers to remain anonymous
Client's family name or last name
The client and/or Caregiver does not know the date of birth of the client
Provide an estimated age or estimated date of birth
The client/Caregiver will provide an estimated age or estimated date of birth
Estimated Date of Birth of the Client
Estimated Date of Birth of the Client
the child could have been created from the mother therefore a relatedpersom may already exist select_one RelatedPerson candidateExpression
The relationship of the Caregiver to the client
The client's mother and father's vital status
The client's mother and father's vital status
Caregiver wants to receive SMS or other messages regarding the child's visits and health status
The Caregiver wants to receive SMS or other messages regarding the client's contacts/visits and health status
The reason for the client's consultation
The client's visit is for a well child but the child is also presenting as sick
The client's visit is for a new consultation
The healthcare worker chooses if they will continue to assess the sick child with a life threatening illness
The client is reported to have had one or more convulsions
The client is unconcious or Lethargic
Not able to drink or breastfeed
The client has reported not to have been able to drink or breastfeed or currently is not able to drink or breastfeed.
The client is reported to be vomiting everything or vomiting but not everything or no vomiting
The client's axillary temperature in degrees Celsius (temperature taken under the armpit)
A thermometer is not available to accurately measure the client's temperature
The client is hot to touch
The client's Temperature has been measured
The client's weight cannot be measured
The client's weight has been estimated - to be used for treatment dosing only
The health care worker would prefer to measure the client using length
The client's height cannot be measured
The client's length cannot be measured
The client's weight for age z score
The client's Mid Upper Arm Circumference in Millimeters (child â‰¥6 months old)
The client's Mid Upper Arm Circumference cannot be measured
Visually assess for whether underweight (for drug dose calculation)
The health care worker visually assesses for whether underweight (for drug dosing calculations)
The client is reported to have had one or more convulsions
The client is reported to have difficulty with Feeding
The client is reported to have diarrhoea
The client has severe chest indrawing
The health care worker's assessments of the client's movements
The client's umbilicus is red or is draining pus
The client has yellow palms or yellow soles
When did the Jaundice first appear?
The age at which the Jaundice first appeared
The healthcare worker pinches the skin of the client's abdomen for 1 second and then observes how long the skin takes to return to normal once released
The client is restless and irritable
Breastfed how many times in 24 hours?
Number of times the client is breastfed in 24 hours
Based on the number of feeds during a 24 hour period the result is auto-calculated to determine sufficient feeds
Young Infant receives food or fluids other than breast milk
The client is receiving other food or drinks besides breastmilk
What milk is being given as a replacement feed?
The health care worker discusses the milk being given to the client as a replacement feed and determines if it is appropriate replacement milk
How many replacement feeds during the day and night (24 hours)?
How often the client is receiving replacement feeds during the day and night (24 hours)
Based on the number of feeds during the day and night (24 hours) the result is auto-calculated to determine sufficient replacement feeds
How much milk is given at each feed (ml)?
The amount of milk given to the client at each feed
The care giver is giving sufficient replacement feeds
Description of how the milk is prepared for the client's feed
Description on how the client is given the milk - bottle or cup
How are the feeding utensils cleaned?
Description of how the feeding utensils are cleaned
Do you give any breastmilk at all?
Does the care giver give the client any breastmilk at all?
Ulcers or White Patches in Mouth
The client has ulcers or white patches in the mouth
Unable to check if Ulcers or White Patches in Mouth
The healthcare worker is unable to check if the client has ulcers or white patches in the mouth
The client is reported to have or has had a cough
Length of time the client is reported to have or has had the cough
The client is reported to have or has had difficulty breathing
The length of time the client has or has had difficulty breathing
The client is reported to have or has had diarrhoea
The length of time the client is reported to have or has had diarrhoea
Blood in the stool in this Illness
The client is reported to have or has had blood in the stool in this Illness
The client is reported to have or has had fever
Has Fever been present every day since the Fever started?
The client has had fever present every day since the fever started
The client is reported to have had or has an ear problem
The client is reported to have had or has ear pain
The client is reported to have or has had ear discharge
The length of time client has or has had ear discharge
The client is reported to have an eye problem
The client is reported to have or has had a skin problem
The client is reported to have itchy skin
The client has stridor in a calm child while the client is at rest
The client has experienced recurrent wheeze
The client's oxygen saturation is less than 90 %
The healthcare worker pinches the skin of the client's abdomen for 1 second and then observes how long the skin takes to return to normal once released
The client is restless and irritable
The client has a throat problem
Specify the throat problem the client has
Enlarged lymph nodes on front of neck
The client has enlarged lymph node(s) on the front of the neck
The client has tender swelling behind the ear
Pus Seen Draining from the Ear
The client has pus draining from the ear which has been seen by the health care worker
Pus Seen Draining from the Ear for how long?
The length of time the client has or has had pus draining from the ear
The client has a stiff neck
The client has a Runny nose
The client has pus draining from the eye
The client has clouding of the cornea
Is Clouding of the Cornea a new problem
Clouding of the cornea in the client is a new problem
Has Clouding of the Cornea previously been treated
Clouding of the cornea has not been previously treated in the client
The client has a generalised or localised skin problem
The client has a measles rash
The client has had measles in the last 3 months
The client has blisters, sores or pustules
The client has a specific type of skin problem(s)
The client has Scalp Infection (tinea capitis)
The client has severe chickenpox rash
The client has disseminated herpes zoster
The client has Herpes Zoster with Eye Involvement
The client has skin infection that extends to muscle
The client has Extensive impetigo lesions requiring oral antibiotics
The client has Extensive molluscum lesions
Molluscum lesions close to the eye
The client has molluscum lesions close to the eye
The client has severe Seborrhoeic Dermatitis
The client has secondary bacterial infection of eczema
Severe acute moist or weeping eczema
The client has severe acute moist or weeping eczema
Secondary herpes infection of eczema (eczema herpeticum)
The client has secondary herpes infection of eczema (eczema herpeticum)
The client has oral sores or mouth ulcers
Add a Skin or Mouth or Eye Problem
The health care worker would like to add a Skin or Mouth or Eye problem found during the physical exam
The client has Mucous membrane pallor
Unable to Perform Oral Fluid Test
The healthcare worker is Unable to Perform Oral Fluid Test
Completely Unable to Drink or Vomits Immediately / Everything
When are present when the healthcare worker is Unable to Perform Oral Fluid Test it is assumed that the client is completely unable to drink or vomits immediately / everything
Has the Child had anything to drink today?
The health care worker asks the caregiver if the client has had anything to drink today
How did the child last drink
The health care worker asks the caregiver how did the client last drink
The client's respiratory rate for client's aged 2 months or more
Unable to perform Respiratory Rate at this time
The client's respiratory rate could not be measured at this time (all ages)
Respiratory Rate Second Count (breaths per minute)
The client's respiratory rate for the second Count
Respiratory Rate Second Count Not Possible
The client's respiratory rate for the second Count was not possible
The client has fast breathing - auto-calculated based on the respiratory rate and the age of the client - 60 breaths per minute or more (<2 months) after 2 respiratory rate measurements
The Inhaled bronchodilator trial test results
Inhaled Bronchodilator Trial Not Feasible or Available
No Fast Breathing and No Chest Indrawing (post Inhaled Bronchodilator Trial)
The client has no fast breathing and no chest indrawing
Breastfeeding Assessment to ensure the client does not have difficulty breastfeeding
The breastfeeding assessment was not possible
The client has breastfed in the previous hour
Mother able to wait until young infant is willing to breastfeed again
The client's mother is able to wait until young infant is willing to breastfeed again
The client's mother reports that there is difficulty breastfeeding (not observed)
The client's chin is touching the breast
The client's mouth is wide open
The client's lower lip is turned outwards
More Areola Visible above than below the Mouth
The mother has more areola visible above than below the client's mouth
The client is taking slow deep sucks, sometimes pausing
The breastfeeding assessment was not observed however the caregiver has reported difficulty breastfeeding
The healthcare worker has observed that the client has difficulty breastfeeding
The client's axillary temperature (second measurement) in degrees Celcius (temperature taken under the armpit)
The client's second temperature measurement is feasible
Possible Serious Bacterial Infection OR Very Severe Disease
Feeding Problem and / or Low Weight for Age
Severe Pneumonia or Very Severe Disease
The client has Pneumonia with wheezing
with cough or difficulty breathing for 14 days or more or recurrent wheeze
The client has Pneumonia with cough or difficulty breathing for 14 days or more or recurrent wheeze
The client has Cough or Cold
The client has Cough or Cold with wheezing
with cough or difficulty breathing for 14 days or more or recurrent wheeze
The client has with cough for more than 14 days or difficulty breathing for more than 14 days or recurrent wheeze
The client has Severe Persistent Diarrhoea
Fever present every day for 7 Days or more
Measles with Eye or Mouth Complication
Papular Urticaria or Papular Pruritic Eruptions
extends to muscle or with measured fever
with extensive lesions or lesions close to the eye
Severe acute moist or weeping eczema
Low MUAC or visual report of wasting
The client's sex is not specified
estimated age in years/months for child (2 months or older)
The age of the client is estimated based on physical evidence
estimated age in weeks/days for young infant (under 2 months old)
The Caregiver provides the age in weeks/days/hours
Estimated Date of Birth of the Client
The Caregiver is the client's mother
The Caregiver is the client's father
The Caregiver is the client's sibling
The Caregiver is the client's extended family
The Caregiver is the client's legal guardian
The Caregiver is not related to the client
The client's visit is for a sick child consultation
The client's visit is for a well child consultation
The client's visit is for a new consultation
The client's visit is for a follow up consultation
The client has had fever for 7 days or more
The client has had fever for less than 7 days
The client has had ear discharge for 14 days or more
The client has had ear discharge for less than 14 days
The clients oxygen saturation was not measured
The client is reported to have had two or more convulsions in this illness
The client is reported to have had one convulsion in this illness
The client has a low body temperature based on the second measurement
skin pinch goes back very slowly (more than 2 seconds)
The client's skin goes back very slowly after Skin pinch of Abdomen (More than 2 seconds)
skin pinch goes back slowly (2 seconds or fewer, but not immediately)
The client's skin goes back slowly after Skin pinch of Abdomen (2 seconds or fewer, but not immediately)
The client's skin goes back normally after Skin pinch of Abdomen (immediately)
mouth sores or mouth ulcers - deep and extensive
The client has mouth sores or mouth ulcers that are deep and extensive
mouth sores or mouth ulcers - not deep and extensive
The client has mouth sores or mouth ulcers that are not deep and extensive
no oral sores or mouth ulcers
The client is not reported to have oral sores or mouth ulcers
The client has severe palmar pallor
The client has some palmar pallor
The client has no palmar pallor
not able to feed at all
The client is reported not to be able to feed at all
The client is reported to not be feeding well
The client is reported to be feeding well
moves on his or her own or moves spontaneously or without stimulation
The client moves on his or her own or moves spontaneously or without stimulation
movement only when stimulated but then stops
The client has movement but only when stimulated and then movement stops
The client has no movement at all even after stimulation
within less than 24 hours of birth
The client's Jaundice appeared less than 24 hours after birth
The client's Jaundice appeared 24 hours or more after birth
The caregiver does not know when the Jaundice first appeared if it is a first visit for jaundice and in the first 3 weeks of life
The client has a very low weight for age (Weight < 2Kg and <7 Days old)
The client has a low weight for age (derived from a WFA Z Score is < -2)
The client is a normal weight for age (derived from a normal WFA Z Score is â‰¥ -2
Breastmilk is also given to the client by the care giver
The client has not been stabilised and the healthcare worker willend the consultation
The client has been stabilised and the healthcare worker will continue the consultation
The client's mother is HIV positive
The client's mother is HIV negative
mother hiv status - unknown or not tested
The client's mother's HIV Status is unknown or not tested
mother hiv status - decline to answer
The client's mother has declined to answer regarging HIV Status
The care giver is preparing the milk correctly and hygenically
The care giver is not preparing the milk correctly and hygenically
The milk is given to the client using a cup
The milk is given to the client using a bottle
The care giver is not cleaning the feeding utensils hygienically
The care giver is cleaning the feeding utensils hygienically
yes, date documented, but not here
The caregiver is able to provide the Vitamin A supplement date but not Today
no, but last dose given less than 1 month ago
The caregiver is able to tell the healthcare worker that the last dose was given less than 1 month ago
no, but last dose given between 1 and 6 months ago
The caregiver is able to tell the healthcare worker that the last dose was given between 1 and 5 months ago
no, but last dose given more than 6 months ago
The caregiver is able to tell the healthcare worker that the last dose was given more than 6 months ago
no, do not know when last dose was given
The caregiver is not able to tell the healthcare worker when the last dose was given
The client is in an area of HIV prevalence of high HIV risk.
The client is in an area of HIV prevalence of low HIV risk.
The client is HIV Positive (Virological Test)
The client is HIV Positive (Serological Test)
child hiv positive - unknown type of test
The client is HIV Positive (Unknown Type of Test)
child hiv status - unknown or not tested
The client's HIV Status is unknown or the client has not been tested
child hiv status - decline to answer
The client has delined to answer regarding HIV Status
The client has received all vaccinations for age
The client has not received all vaccinations for age
no, the child has never received any vaccinations to date
The client has never received any vaccinations to date
It is not known if the client has received any vaccination
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
pcv booster 1 for confirmed hiv infection
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
pcv booster 2 for confirmed hiv infection
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
Data Element to appear so that the healthcare worker can see which vaccines the client should have received for their age
The client is completely unable to drink
The client was able to finish the RUTF (the client was able to finish the minimum amount of RTUF (at least one-third of a packet of RUTF portion (92g) or 3 teaspoons from a pot within 30 minutes)
The client was unable to finish the RUTF (the client was unable to eat one-third of a packet of RUTF portion (92g) or 3 teaspoons from a pot within 30 minutes)
The healthcare worker did not have any RUTF available to carry out the appetite test
The client is not well attached to breast
The client has a good attachment
The client is not sucking effectively
The client's Microscopy species result is no species reported
The client has a Red (congested) throat
The client has Exudate on Throat
The client has Membrane on throat
none of the listed throat problems observed
The client has None of the listed throat problems observed
The client can swallow without difficulty
The client has Difficulty in swallowing
The client is Unable to swallow
does not appear to be underweight

The client is visually assessed for whether underweight by the health care worker and does not appear to be underweight (estimated weight based on height or age would be equivalent to WHZ= 0 / WAZ= 0)

The client is visually assessed for whether underweight by the health care worker and appears to be underweight (as an aide for dosing calculations) (estimated weight based on height or age would be equivalent to WHZ= -1 / WAZ= -1)

The client is visually assessed for whether underweight and appears to be severely underweight (as an aide for dosing calculations) (estimated weight based on height or age would be equivalent to WHZ= -2 / WAZ= -2)
The client has severe mucous membrane pallor
The client has some mucous membrane pallor
The client has no mucous membrane pallor
The client has a generalised skin problem
The client has a localised skin problem
The client does not have a generalised or localised skin problem
papular urticaria or papular pruritic eruptions

The client has Papular Urticaria or Papular Pruritic Eruptions â€¢ Itchy papules at different stages of evolution. â€¢ Found on the arms and legs. â€¢ Healed lesions are often dark/ hyperpigmented. â€¢ The itch is difficult to manage. â€¢ Essential to exclude scabies.
The client has Ringworm (Tinea) - â€¢ An itchy circular lesion with a raised edge and fine scaly area. â€¢ Scalp lesions may result in loss of hair

The client has Scabies - â€¢ Intense itching, more severe at night. â€¢ Small burrows between fingers, tows, elbow areas and buttocks. â€¢ Secondary infection may occur. â€¢ Small babies may have vesicles and pustules on the palms and soles and face. â€¢ The infestation spreads easily, usually affecting more than one person in the household

The client has Chickenpox - Mild fever preceding the rash. â€¢ Rash begins on the trunk and face, later spreads to the arms and legs. â€¢ Vesicles appear progressively over days and forms scabs after they rupture. â€¢ Contagious from the fever starts until all lesions have crusted. â€¢ Usually lasts for about 1 week.
The client has Herpes Zoster - Vesicles in one area on one side of body with intense pain or scars plus shooting pain. â€¢ They are uncommon in children except when they are immune-compromised
The client has Impetigo- Pustules and papules with honey -coloured crusts. â€¢ Commonly starts on the face or buttocks, then spreads to the neck, hands, arms and legs.
The client has Molluscum Contagiosum -Caused by a poxvirus. â€¢ Dome-shaped papules with a central depression (umblication). â€¢ Most commonly seen on the face and trunk in children
The client has Warts - Appears as papules or nodules with a rough surface. â€¢ Seen most often on the hands and fingers, but can be found anywhere on the body.

The client has Seborrhoeic Dermatitis - Greasy scales and redness on central face, body folds. â€¢ The scalp, face, ears and skin folds (e.g. axillae, groins, under the breasts) are commonly affected.
The client has Fixed Drug Reaction - One or more dark round or oval skin lesions with central vesicles . â€¢ The lesions recur on the same spot, and increase in number with each successive attack
The client has Eczema - Erythematous (red), sometimes scaly plaques found on the face, flexures, trunk and extensors. â€¢ Yellow pustules which crust indicate secondary bacterial infection.

The client has Steven Johnson Syndrome (SJS) - Severe and acute reaction due to many drugs, the commonest being cotrimoxazole or nevirapine. â€¢ Lesions involve the skin as well as the mucous membranes (e.g. eyes, mouth and genitalia). â€¢ May start as widespread red irregular rash with or without blisters. The blisters rupture leaving denuded areas of skin. â€¢ May cause difficulty in breathing.
The health care worker would like to add a skin problem
The health care worker would like to add an Oral Sores or Mouth Ulcers problem
The health care worker would like to add an Eye problem
no - do not add a skin or mouth or eye problem
The healthcare worker would not like to add a Skin or Mouth or Eye Problem
The caregiver does not give the client any breastmilk at all
The care giver is giving inappropriate replacement milk
The care giver is giving appropriate replacement milk
no fast breathing and no chest indrawing (post inhaled bronchodilator trial)
inhaled bronchodilator trial not feasible or available

display.value: papular urticaria or papular pruritic eruptions

definition.value: The client has Papular Urticaria or Papular Pruritic Eruptions â€¢ Itchy papules at different stages of evolution. â€¢ Found on the arms and legs. â€¢ Healed lesions are often dark/ hyperpigmented. â€¢ The itch is difficult to manage. â€¢ Essential to exclude scabies.
The client has Ringworm (Tinea) - â€¢ An itchy circular lesion with a raised edge and fine scaly area. â€¢ Scalp lesions may result in loss of hair

The client has Scabies - â€¢ Intense itching, more severe at night. â€¢ Small burrows between fingers, tows, elbow areas and buttocks. â€¢ Secondary infection may occur. â€¢ Small babies may have vesicles and pustules on the palms and soles and face. â€¢ The infestation spreads easily, usually affecting more than one person in the household

The client has Chickenpox - Mild fever preceding the rash. â€¢ Rash begins on the trunk and face, later spreads to the arms and legs. â€¢ Vesicles appear progressively over days and forms scabs after they rupture. â€¢ Contagious from the fever starts until all lesions have crusted. â€¢ Usually lasts for about 1 week.
The client has Herpes Zoster - Vesicles in one area on one side of body with intense pain or scars plus shooting pain. â€¢ They are uncommon in children except when they are immune-compromised
The client has Impetigo- Pustules and papules with honey -coloured crusts. â€¢ Commonly starts on the face or buttocks, then spreads to the neck, hands, arms and legs.
The client has Molluscum Contagiosum -Caused by a poxvirus. â€¢ Dome-shaped papules with a central depression (umblication). â€¢ Most commonly seen on the face and trunk in children
The client has Warts - Appears as papules or nodules with a rough surface. â€¢ Seen most often on the hands and fingers, but can be found anywhere on the body.

The client has Seborrhoeic Dermatitis - Greasy scales and redness on central face, body folds. â€¢ The scalp, face, ears and skin folds (e.g. axillae, groins, under the breasts) are commonly affected.
The client has Fixed Drug Reaction - One or more dark round or oval skin lesions with central vesicles . â€¢ The lesions recur on the same spot, and increase in number with each successive attack
The client has Eczema - Erythematous (red), sometimes scaly plaques found on the face, flexures, trunk and extensors. â€¢ Yellow pustules which crust indicate secondary bacterial infection.

The client has Steven Johnson Syndrome (SJS) - Severe and acute reaction due to many drugs, the commonest being cotrimoxazole or nevirapine. â€¢ Lesions involve the skin as well as the mucous membranes (e.g. eyes, mouth and genitalia). â€¢ May start as widespread red irregular rash with or without blisters. The blisters rupture leaving denuded areas of skin. â€¢ May cause difficulty in breathing.
